description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9kr5f","text":"This protocol details the Caltech-SCFA-methods for measurement of short-chain fatty acids in mouse fecal samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

{"blocks":[{"key":"2t9n1","text":"Store all samples at    until analysis on the same day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":22,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1lff0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"BF80EDA0D27F11EC9F5A852E5BFD5CAC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8v0ee","text":"Mix calibrators of acetic acid, propanoic acid, butyric acid and isobutyric acid (10 nM - 10×103 nM) together with single- and double- blanks, spiked with internal standard mix (Acetic acid-d3, propanoic acid-d2, butyric acid-d2) to a final concentration of   , prepare and subject to the same sample preparation procedure as fecal samples. {"blocks":[{"key":"7fj21","text":"Analyze derivatized samples using an ultra-high performance liquid chromatography (UHPLC) system 1290 connect to a quadrupole time of flight (Q-TOF 6545) mass spectrometer from Agilent Technologies (Santa Clara, CA, USA) equipped with an orthogonal DUAL AJS-ESI interface. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e44ik","text":"Use, a two-solvent gradient running at   min-1 (Mobile Phase: A: 100:0.1 Water: Formic Acid, B: 100:0.1 Isopropanol: Formic Acid) for reverse phase C18 chromatographic separation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":44,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8rf28","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"0.3","error":false,"guid":"85BFC5A0D27F11EC9F5A852E5BFD5CAC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f7hlq","text":"Construct the linear calibration plots for acetic acid, propanoic acid, butyric acid and isobutyric acid using peak area ratios of each analyte to the IS versus the concentrations of calibrators (x) with 1/x weighting, and obtain the least squares linear regression equations as the calibration equations for individual analytes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
